result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/21/22 - The Branch 2 Only warrant is quashed now that the Defendant is in custody. Her signature bond is reinstated. 10:03 AM Defendant Danielle M Hoaglund not in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Danielle M Hoaglund. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
22CF522 was set for Review of OCRP Status. Defense has no indication of their clients whereabouts. 
State moves to Dismiss outright 22CF1329. Court grants and case is Dismissed. 
State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail. 
Court issues a Branch 2 Only Capias and revokes and forfeits bond. 
Court notes that while case is suspended, Defendant has not had a preliminary hearing in this case.

Branch 2 Only
Ext. Code: 3

Defendant to have no contact with victim A or B/witness/address of the vehicle theft listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
02:37 PM Defendant Danielle M Hoaglund in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for Review Hearing and to address Motion to Modify Bond filed 6/21.
Atty Menden has reviewed the competency report with the defendant.
Attorney Menden is not challenging the doctors report.  Defendant does not wish to challenge the report.
State is not challenging the doctors report.
The Court finds the defendant is not competent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate medication and treatment, is likely to attain competency within statutory limits.  
The Court, upon making the finding, suspends the criminal proceedings.
Court will issue an Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency).

Defense makes arguments for modifying bail to a signature bond from cash bond.
State objects to modification of bond for reasons as stated on the record.
Court amends the cash bond to a signature bond with the same conditions.
The Competency Hearing set for 7/18/22 is removed from the calendar.
Court sets a Review Hearing. Defendant to appear in person. 




  Review hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion to Modify Bail filed by Atty. Eryn Menden.

Bail/bond hearing on June 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Competency hearing on July 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

10:06 AM Defendant Danielle M Hoaglund in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for Review Hearing.
State does not contest the findings.
Defense has not had adequate time to review the report with the Defendant.
Defense anticipates this will be a contested hearing. 
Court calls Dr. Collin's Office to get her availability by zoom. Zoom information given to Dr. Collin's office for the Competency Hearing. 
Defense to file motion to modify bond by the end of the day today to be heard on Thursday. 
Bail/Bond and Review will be addressed at the next hearing.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
filed by Dr. Collins.

Review hearing on June 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:00 AM Defendant Danielle M Hoaglund in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
The Court will adjourn the matter to the Trial Court.  Review hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for June 13, 2022.
Preliminary hearing on May 13, 2022 at 09:15 am.

08:57 AM Defendant Danielle M Hoaglund in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties are in agreement to start the preliminary hearing for identification purposes but would like a brief adjournment to have a witness from the City of Brookfield present. Waukesha County Detective Ryan Roeglin sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Nickolie.  Cross examination by Attorney Menden.  The Court finds good cause to continue the matter until Friday.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:15 am.
